description._content: Photographer: George Gustav Heye (GGH), Non-Indian, 1874-1957 Subject: Thea Heye (Mrs. Thea Page), Non-Indian, 1888-1935 Date Created: 1918-1919 Catalog Number: P07797 Format: Albumen print Dimensions: 7 x 9.5 in. Collection History: Between 1917 and 1923, the MAI mounted the Hendricks-Hodge Expedition to explore and excavate the historic Zuni village of Hawikku, one of the most extensive projects of its kind in the Southwest. Documentation of MAI expeditions and excavations often includes photographs of camp life and expedition members. Description: Mrs. Thea Heye posed outdoors at a flagpole and arrow-head-shaped sign that states "Camp Harmon Hawikuh." Desert-like and scrub brush terrain in background Place: Hawikku (Hawikuh) Pueblo ruins; Zuni Reservation; Cibola County; New Mexico; USA Site Name: Hawikku (Hawikuh) Pueblo ruins Culture/People: A:shiwi (Zuni) (archaeological),Non-Indian Culture Hierarchy: Pueblo>A:shiwi (Zuni) (archaeological) Persistent URL:http://www.americanindian.si.edu/searchcollections/item.aspx?irn=317932 Repository:National Museum of the American Indian View more collections from the Smithsonian Institution.
